revised_title: On the Precession of the Equinoxes and the Stability of the Solar System
tldr: The author investigates the precession of the equinoxes and the stability of the solar system, finding that the major axis and eccentricity of a planet's orbit decrease perpetually, while the longitude of the perihelion and the longitude of the epoch remain constant. The stability of the system is determined by the equilibrium of the six constants that define the position of the revolving body and the axis of instantaneous rotation.
